files.patch: @@ -319,1 +319,1 @@ - * {@return A linker option used to mark a function as trivial} + * {@return A linker option used to mark a foreign function as trivial} @@ -321,2 +321,2 @@ - * A 'trivial' function is a function that has an extremely short running time - * in all cases (similar to calling an empty function), and does not call back into Java. + * A trivial function is a function that has an extremely short running time + * in all cases (similar to calling an empty function), and does not call back into Java (e.g. using an upcall stub). @@ -324,1 +324,1 @@ - * Marking a function using this linker option is a hint which some implementations may use to apply + * Using this linker option is a hint which some implementations may use to apply @@ -327,1 +327,1 @@ - * Marking a function that is not trivial using this linker option is likely to have adverse effects, + * Using this linker option when linking non trivial functions is likely to have adverse effects,
